generif.text: overexpression associated with loss of tumor differentiation in human prostate cancer; may play role in acquisition of invasive/metastatic phenotype

Androgen-independent cell line DU145 cells lack PLZF gene expression, resulting in the upregulation of Pbx1 and HoxC8 expression. The Pbx1-HoxC8 heterocomplex may lead to androgen-independent growth in prostate cancer.
Ratio of microRNA to HOXC8 mRNA may be an indicator of the metastatic capability of breast tumors.

a complex role for HOXC8 in prostate cancer, promoting invasiveness while inhibiting AR-mediated gene induction at androgen response element-regulated genes associated with differentiated function of the prostate
HOXC8 expression is inversely related to pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma progression and metastasis.
HOXC8 can be used as a prognostic marker in esophageal squamous cell carcinoma
HOXC8 promotes breast tumorigenesis by transcriptionally facilitating cadherin-11 expression.
miR-196a was over-expressed in cervical cancer cells, while an absence of HOXC8 expression was observed.
Ectopic expression of HoxC8 inhibits nasopharyngeal carcinoma cell growth in vitro and in vivo, modulates glycolysis and regulates the expression of tricarboxylic acid (TCA) cycle-related genes.
embigin is regulated by HOXC8 and its loss plays an important role in the progression of breast tumors
Upregulated HOXC8 expression was associated with oxaliplatin resistance in hepatocellular carcinoma.

Owing to the overexpression of Homeobox C8 (HOXC8), findings implied that HOXC8 is involved in the progression of epithelial ovarian cancer (EOC) and could be a potential therapeutical approach of EOC.

HOXC8 knockdown led to inhibition of tumor cell proliferation and migration in vitro by inhibiting MMP-9 expression and tumor growth in vivo. The results strongly suggest that HOXC8 is involved in the tumorigenesis of osteosarcoma and might serve as a novel predictor for patients' outcome.
High expression of HOXC8 is associated with laryngeal squamous cell carcinoma.

Results show that HOXC8 is consistently downregulated in stem/progenitor cells of all breast molecular subtypes, thus representing a putative tumor suppressor candidate. Also, downregulated expression of HOXC8 is associated with DNA methylation at the gene promoter and expression of miR196 family members. Taken together, study establishes HOXC8 as a suppressor of stemness and transformation in the mammary gland lineage.
these data indicate that E-cadherin is a target gene of HOXC8 and that the loss of E-cadherin promotes the growth and migration of NSCLC.
our results showed that the HOXC8-MGP axis played an important role in the tumorigenesis of Triple-negative breast cancer (TNBC) and might be a promising therapeutic target for TNBC treatment
Homeobox C8 inhibited the osteo-/dentinogenic differentiation and migration ability of stem cells of the apical papilla via activating KDM1A.
MiR-148a-3p may contribute to flawed decidualization in recurrent implantation failure by modulating HOXC8.
An Integrated Genomic Approach Identifies HOXC8 as an Upstream Regulator in Ovarian Endometrioma.
HOXC6/8/10/13 predict poor prognosis and associate with immune infiltrations in glioblastoma.
HOXC8 alleviates high glucose-triggered damage of trophoblast cells during gestational diabetes mellitus via activating TGFbeta1-mediated Notch1 pathway.
Human papillomavirus type 16 E7 promotes cell viability and migration in cervical cancer by regulating the miR-23a/HOXC8 axis.
DNA Methylation-Regulated HOXC8's Role in HER2-Positive Breast Cancer Function and its Contribution to Herceptin Resistance.
N6-methyladenosine-modified circSLCO1B3 promotes intrahepatic cholangiocarcinoma progression via regulating HOXC8 and PD-L1.

wikipathways.name: Differentiation of white and brown adipocyte

summary: This gene belongs to the homeobox family of genes. The homeobox genes encode a highly conserved family of transcription factors that play an important role in morphogenesis in all multicellular organisms. Mammals possess four similar homeobox gene clusters, HOXA, HOXB, HOXC and HOXD, which are located on different chromosomes and consist of 9 to 11 genes arranged in tandem. This gene is one of several homeobox HOXC genes located in a cluster on chromosome 12. The product of this gene may play a role in the regulation of cartilage differentiation. It could also be involved in chondrodysplasias or other cartilage disorders. [provided by RefSeq, Jul 2008].
